channel.title: Suicide
channel.description: Right to die? Or is it just plain selfish?

item.title: Suicide
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Bowser jr:

Bullshit. That is what life is, an infinite promise that someday life will get better. But it doesn’t get better.

Thanks for showing I’m not the only one thinking like this.

@everyone against suicide
If they go now or in 50 years, what’s the difference?
We all end up the same, so if some one doesn’t want to wait that long to get out of here then what’s the big deal.

Read full topic

item.title: Suicide
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Though I do agree that allot of the teens committing suicide are stupid because of the fact that they're so young, and they have a much better life ahead of them just because of the freedom they get alone.
Bullshit. That is what life is, an infinite promise that someday life will get better. But it doesn't get better. If you are able to fuck it up when you had a good chance of success, why should you believe that you should be able to fix your life when the chances are slimmer?

Read full topic

item.title: Suicide
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Fails, post:68, topic:462353”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=565434.msg4118643#msg4118643 date=1349408322]
I believe suicide is just completely ignorant. People need to really grasp the fact that this world is full of many different people; some people may be nice, but others are just waiting to put a stake into your heart, simply because that is what make them happy. As long as you care about your future and your happiness, you should push those people away from you and do your best because you only have one life.
[/quote]
it does take balls to commit suicide.[/quote]
Takes just as much to not do it and deal with it

Read full topic

item.title: Suicide
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Ruby:

People who commit suicide sicken me if I’m honest. It’s not bad enough to take your own life, it never is. A lot of people commit at a young age(teens) and its just idiotic. They have their entire life to go through and after high school you barely talk to anyone you were there with. Taking your own life proves how weak you are; no matter how much someone bullies you or how hard it is at home there’s always help available and for them to take their own life is just silly, it’s incredibly selfish. There’s always people who care so get a grip and wait it out.

Depends on the circumstances. If someone is being tortured, how are they selfish for wanting out? Whether it be mentally or physically, it shouldn’t matter, their life is their business and if they want to rid of it them let them. The reason I say it’s not is because it’s more than likely even more selfish to force a family member to stay alive if he really wants to die. Think about it, it’s a way to end his/her suffering for good. Even if there’s good down the raod, that doesn’t mean they can bare the journey.

Though I do agree that allot of the teens committing suicide are stupid because of the fact that they’re so young, and they have a much better life ahead of them just because of the freedom they get alone.

Tutorial:

I believe suicide is just completely ignorant. People need to really grasp the fact that this world is full of many different people; some people may be nice, but others are just waiting to put a stake into your heart, simply because that is what make them happy. As long as you care about your future and your happiness, you should push those people away from you and do your best because you only have one life.

As I’ve said, not everyone has the same willpower. Some people can escape from Joseph Kony, while others can barely stand a broken bone.

Read full topic

item.title: Suicide
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Ruby:

People who commit suicide sicken me if I’m honest. It’s not bad enough to take your own life, it never is. A lot of people commit at a young age(teens) and its just idiotic. They have their entire life to go through and after high school you barely talk to anyone you were there with. Taking your own life proves how weak you are; no matter how much someone bullies you or how hard it is at home there’s always help available and for them to take their own life is just silly, it’s incredibly selfish. There’s always people who care so get a grip and wait it out.

Maybe their whole life ahead is ruined because of someone else? What if they had no chance at doing what they dream because of their stature. I would kill myself if there wasn’t much left.

I actually tried to commit suicide and my mother just watched. I think suicide is something that says “I hate my life.” I don’t think it’s selfish but something to get attention.

Read full topic

As long as you care about your future and your happiness, you should push those people away from you and do your best because you only have one life.

also, how is it ignorant? if one does not want to live, they have every right not to.

item.title: Suicide
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:57, topic:462353”]@Java, you are 99% correct but that is why I think we don’t deserve to live. We are so crude, we are pointless, we fear death when our own bodies are made to die (our genes are programmed or w.e. you want to call it to age) and so on.
I’m the type of guy that thinks nothing has the right to life, nor the right to feel pain. We go living through life always in despair and of course their is happiness too but whats the point? I go to college to learn to then hopefully get a job later on so I have money and I can buy things (for the most part) to entertain me and make me forget temporarily how pointless we are. What is the point?
I’m not saying I want to die or anything, I fear pain etcetc but I’m just saying that life is pointless. Everything we do causes harm.
In our own world so many people feel pain and what for; Selfish needs that our brain makes us feel? In all honesty it makes me almost sad thinking about life in this way but to me at least this is the truth and to ignore the truth is arrogance. However I am not forcing you to believe what I believe in and of course I welcome you to challenge what I say.[/quote]
In the grand scale of things everything is pointless, it just happened to come into existence one day. The only real point is to continue on our lives. Despite us being pointless, that doesn’t mean we can’t enrich out lives with happiness while we’re still alive, witch is probably the reason we’ve come so far and done so much to planet itself, because it prevents people from dying so suddenly and prevents rather pointless deaths.

I suppose what I’m trying to say is that there is no reason nor point that we exist, but as long as we do we might as well make the best of it, because someday, it will all be gone.

Read full topic

item.title: Suicide
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

@Java, you are 99% correct but that is why I think we don’t deserve to live. We are so crude, we are pointless, we fear death when our own bodies are made to die (our genes are programmed or w.e. you want to call it to age) and so on.
I’m the type of guy that thinks nothing has the right to life, nor the right to feel pain. We go living through life always in despair and of course their is happiness too but whats the point? I go to college to learn to then hopefully get a job later on so I have money and I can buy things (for the most part) to entertain me and make me forget temporarily how pointless we are. What is the point?
I’m not saying I want to die or anything, I fear pain etcetc but I’m just saying that life is pointless. Everything we do causes harm.
In our own world so many people feel pain and what for; Selfish needs that our brain makes us feel? In all honesty it makes me almost sad thinking about life in this way but to me at least this is the truth and to ignore the truth is arrogance. However I am not forcing you to believe what I believe in and of course I welcome you to challenge what I say.

Read full topic

item.title: Suicide
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:55, topic:462353”]The way we live dictates its selfish to communicate suicide.
However, its good for the planet if we commit suicide as we are a plague and we destroy, use, abuse a lot of things if the result is of benefit for us.
I’m an ass, I don’t deserve to live like most other people. I don’t feel bad about the damage I do to things even though I’m aware I do it. Now tell me, what is our right to live?[/quote]
We destroy things on the planet because we were made in the same way as all other life here was. Whether it actually be from a god or from long years of evolution, we all got here in an extremely similar fashion.

One of the basic things that every living thing knows is survival of the fittest. If we developed the intellect to enhance our lives, then why shouldn’t we do it? The planet itself will exist for billions of more years, there’s no way for us to destroy it, but we can wipe out the life that it has, because we’re currently the dominate species. As long as we live, we can use what brain power we have to enjoy our lives in the best way possible.

Not only that, but there are billions of other planets out there and with that billions of possibilities for other organic life, if one planet becomes devoid of life, there are possibly millions others to replace it. Life is fairly irrelevant to the universe itself anyways.

Read full topic

If a film was horrible and you couldn’t stand it, you’d walk out of it. If it genuinely upset you, someone forcing you to stay would be selfish.
[/quote]

If you wanted to leave but your friend didn’t want to leave, then what?[/quote]
Then your friend would be selfish. If everyone wanted you to jump off a cliff, would you? As stated before, it’s your life, not theirs.
